msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; some numbers of drachmas and obols are written on the Verso.
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and right hand sides. The top and the bottom are irregularly cut. 2 Kollesis at the beginning of the column and in the middle of col. 96. there is a big lacuna in the left hand side of the column, as well as small ones as the result of a fold. Also there are some lacunae in col. 96 in several places. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated a new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the tax payer. The scribe some numbers of drachmas and obols, presumably as a draft. (MA)

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Phanomgeus, son of Phanomgeus, grandson of Phanomgeus, mother Taptosiris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 245)
Chairemon the son, mother Tbelles (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 247)
Besis, son of Petheus, grandson of Akousilaos, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 159)
Aphrodisios, son of Sisois, grandson Petheus, mother Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 158)
Ptolemaios, son Naaraus, grandson of Theabenis, mother Tamarres (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 217)
Sambas, son of Onnophris, grandson of Sambas, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 223)
Sambas, son of Sokmenis, grandson of Sambas, mother Tkollainis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 224)
Dios, son of Petheus, grandson of Heras, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 160)
Ptolemaios, son of Apynchis, grandson Aunes, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 216)
Petaus, son of Esouris, grandson of Petheus, mother Tkollauthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 208)
Heras, son of Onnophris, son of Onnophris, mother Sopas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 169)
Ptolemaios, son of Petheus, grandson of Sokmenis, mother Tapapeis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 218)
Petheus, the son, mother Tkelbaus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 204)
Chairedemos, son of Petoraipis, grandson of Onnophris, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 248)
Athenion, son of Pyrrhos, grandson of Athenion, mother Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 150)
Nekpheraus, son of Euhemeros, grandson of Nekpheraus, mother Taonnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 190)
Gaios Julius Apolinarios (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 159)
Heraklas son of Tamen (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 167)
Gaios Julius Priskos (Niken the slave) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 159)
Pnepheros, son of Petaus, grandson of Petaus, mother Taeuhemeros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 213)

Herieus, son of Horos, grandson of Pnepheros, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 163)
Petheus, son of Peteesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 203)
Petheus, son of Thanouansis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 205)
Sarapias, daughter of Sarapion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 225)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
